subject: JunitPerf
msgSnippet: I m currently trying to make a JunitPerf to be able to monitor the NamingService response time (for EJB s development). As a matter of fact VisualAge Websphere
messageBody:
I'm currently trying to make a JunitPerf to be able to monitor the NamingService response time (for EJB's development). As a matter of fact VisualAge Websphere Test environment is a real snail & lookups can take sometimes many seconds. My problem is the fact that the potential real issue is the latency in the response.

I was wandering if someone could help in defining a way to avoid the overhead of the System.currentTimemillis() coded in the JunitPerf. On the production environment the biggest part of the response time is divided in three parts - believe - :
1. CurrentTime access
2. Naming access
3. CurrentTime access

To reduce the influence of the timing, I can loop the Naming Access, but then I get the caching kicking in.

If someone had an hint to keep the test as simple as possible (no looping on all the Names to access)...

Tx,

Thomas,
